1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: CMD.C Thu 08-24-2000 9:18:49 am HvA V1.00 $
3    | 
4    | This file contains the command interpreter.
5    | It will build a command from getting data from the ringbuffer
6    | If the terminator is encountered, it will interpretate and
7    | execute the command
8    | ***************************************************************************/
9    | 
10   | #include <stdio.h>
11   | #include <stdlib.h>
12   | #include <string.h>
13   | #include <stdarg.h>
14   | 
15   | #include "fortify.h"
16   | #include "agwsubs.h"
17   | #include "ringbuf.h"
18   | #include "tn_srv.h"
19   | #include "cmd.h"
20   | 
21   | extern char agwpe_version[];
22   | extern char agwpe_portinfo[];
23   | extern char mycall[];			/*+ Callsign of this station  +*/
24   | extern char tocall[];			/*+ Callsign of other station +*/
25   | extern int  agwpe_status;
26   | 
27   | static char cmd[160];			/*+ Linear buffer (string) for the command +*/
28   | static int  ptr = 0;			/*+ Pointer to postion in cmd buffer during build of command +*/
29   | 
30   | 
31   | /*+ Local prototypes +*/
32   | static int terminator(RINGBUF *buf);
33   | static void output(char *format, ...);
34   | static void print_usage(void);
35   | 
36   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
37   | Print command overview
38   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
39   | void
40   | print_usage(void)
41   | {
42   |   output("\n------------------");
43   |   output("\nAvailable commands");
44   |   output("\n------------------");
45   |   output("\nH = Help");
46   |   output("\nV = AGWPE version");
47   |   output("\nP = Port information");
48   |   output("\nX = eXit telnet interface");
49   |   output("\nC = Connect to station");
50   |   output("\nD = Disconnect from station");
51   |   output("\nR = Heard stations on port 0");
52   |   output("\nQ = Quit program");
53   | }
54   | 
55   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
56   | Execute the command given.
57   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
58   | int exec_cmd(char *cmd)		/*+ Pointer to the command string to execute +*/
59   | /*+ Returns 0 on success, -1 on failure +*/
60   | {
61   |   char c;
62   | 
63   |   if (!(agwpe_status & CMD_MODE)) {
64   |     printf("\nERROR: interface is not in command mode.");
65   | 	printf("\nThe interface is ignoring the command.");
66   |   }
67   | 
68   |   strupr(cmd);
69   | 
70   |   if (strstr(cmd,"CONV")) {
71   |     output("Going to converse mode\n");
72   | 	agwpe_status &= ~CMD_MODE;
73   | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
74   |   }
75   | 
76   |   if (cmd[0] == 'V') {
77   |     output("AGWPE version  : %s\n",agwpe_version);
78   | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
79   |   }
80   | 
81   |   if (cmd[0] == 'P') {
82   |     output("AGWPE portinfo : %s\n",agwpe_portinfo);
83   | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
84   |   }
85   | 
86   |   if (cmd[0] == 'H' || cmd[0] == '?') {
87   |     print_usage();
88   | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
89   |   }
90   | 
91   |   /*--- Exit telnet interface  */
92   |   if (cmd[0] == 'X') {
93   |     output("Closing all connections\n");
94   | 	#ifdef TN_SRV
95   |       tn_close_all();
96   | 	#endif
97   | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
98   |   }
99   | 
100  |   if (cmd[0] == 'C') {
101  |     sscanf(cmd,"%c %s",&c,tocall);
102  |     output("Connecting to %s\n",tocall);
103  | 	agwpe_connect(0,tocall);
104  | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
105  |   }
106  | 
107  |   if (cmd[0] == 'R') {
108  | 	agwpe_heard(0);
109  | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
110  |   }
111  | 
112  |   if (cmd[0] == 'D') {
113  |     output("Disconnecting from %s\n",tocall);
114  | 	agwpe_disconnect(0,tocall);
115  | 	return(CMD_SUCCESS);
116  |   }
117  | 
118  |   if (cmd[0] == 'Q') {
119  |     exit(0);
120  |   }
121  | 
122  |   /*--- If we come here, the command was not recognized  */
123  |   output("Unknown command %s\n",cmd);
124  |   return(CMD_UNKNOWN);
125  |     
126  | }
127  | 
128  | 
129  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
130  | Retrieve a command from the ringbuffer. If the command building
131  | is still in progress, this function will return a NULL pointer. If
132  | the terminators are found, then the command will be NIL terminated
133  | and the pointer to the command will be returned.
134  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
135  | char *get_cmd(RINGBUF *buf)
136  | /*+ Returns pointer to complete command, or NULL if command was not complete yet +*/
137  | {
138  |   int count;		/*+ Number of bytes, retrieved from ring buffer +*/
139  |   BYTE c;			/*+ Byte, retrieved from ring buffer +*/
140  | 
141  |   if (terminator(buf)) {
142  |     cmd[ptr] = '\0';
143  | 	ptr = 0;
144  |     return(cmd);
145  |   }
146  |   else
147  |     count = ringbuf_get(buf,&c);
148  |   while (count > 0) {
149  |     cmd[ptr++] = (char) c;
150  | 	if (terminator(buf)) {
151  | 	  cmd[ptr] = '\0';		/*--- Terminate string  */
152  | 	  ptr = 0;				/*--- Reset pointer to start of string  */
153  | 	  return(cmd);
154  | 	}
155  | 	else
156  | 	  count = ringbuf_get(buf,&c);
157  |   }
158  |   return(NULL);			/*--- No terminator found yet  */
159  | 
160  | }
161  | 
162  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
163  | Check if terminator CR is seen. If there is also a LF, it will
164  | also be removed from the ring buffer.
165  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
166  | static int terminator(RINGBUF *buf)
167  | /*+ Return 1 if terminator is found, 0 if not +*/
168  | {
169  |   int count;
170  |   BYTE c;
171  | 
172  |   count = ringbuf_peek(buf,&c);		/*--- See if a character is available  */
173  | 
174  |   if (count != 0 && c==0x0D) {	  	/*--- If there is a CR  */
175  |      ringbuf_get(buf,&c);			/*--- Get the CR  */
176  | 	 count = ringbuf_peek(buf,&c);	/*--- See if next char is available */
177  | 	 if (count != 0 && c==0x0A) {	/*--- If it is a LF  */
178  | 	   ringbuf_get(buf,&c);			/*--- Get the LF  */
179  | 	   return(1);		 	    	/*--- Return 'end of command found'  */
180  | 	 }
181  | 	 return(1);
182  |   }
183  | 
184  |   return(0);						/*--- No end of command found */
185  | 
186  | }
187  | 
188  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
189  | Show prompt character. This is only done when were are in command mode
190  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
191  | void disp_prompt(void)
192  | {
193  |   /*--- If not in command mode, return  */
194  |   if (!(agwpe_status & CMD_MODE))
195  |     return;
196  | 
197  |   /*--- We are in command mode. Print the prompt  */
198  |   printf("\n> ");
199  |   #ifdef TN_SRV
200  |   if (agwpe_status & TN_CONNECTED)
201  |     tn_printf("\n\r> ");
202  |   #endif
203  | }
204  | 
205  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
206  | Output string to stdout and to the telnet socket
207  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
208  | static void output(char *format, ...)
209  | {
210  |   va_list arg;
211  | 
212  |   #ifdef TN_SRV
213  |   char s[180];
214  |   #endif
215  |  
216  |   va_start(arg, format);
217  | 
218  |   /*--- Print to standard output  */
219  |   vprintf(format,arg);
220  | 
221  |   #ifdef TN_SRV
222  |   /*--- Send to telnet socket  */
223  |   if (agwpe_status & TN_CONNECTED) {
224  |     vsprintf(s, format, arg);
225  |     tn_printf("%s",s);
226  |   }
227  |   #endif
228  | 
229  |   va_end(arg);
230  | }
231  |
